title: James Carville
added: Carville consulted in 1990 for former Texas Congressman and sitting state [[Texas Attorney General|state Attorney General]] [[Jim Mattox]] in his unsuccessful bid for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination that year.

On advice from Carville, who had used the tactic in consulting for candidates in other states, Mattox based his campaign on the claim that a [[state lottery]] would solve Texas' revenue needs without additional state taxes.<ref>{{cite news |last= McNeely|first= Dave|date= February 3, 1991|title= Lawmakers weigh the odds on backing state lottery|work= The Austin American Statesman newspaper|location= Auston, Texas}}</ref> With no facts to support the charge, Mattox also ran a television advertisement accusing his primary opponent, State Treasurer [[Ann Richards]] a recovering alcoholic, as a marijuana and cocaine user who might falter in handling the strains associated with being governor.<ref>{{cite news |last= Baer|first= Susan|date= March 6, 2000|title= Consultant has Gore ready for battle; Strategist: One of the Democratic Party's fiercest warriors is a key player in the revamped campaign.|work= The Baltimore Sun|location= Baltimore, Maryland}}</ref>

title: James Carville
added: In 1999, [[Gennifer Flowers]] sued Carville, his campaign colleague [[George Stephanopoulos]] and others for [[defamation]], and later amended the suit in 2000 to include [[Hillary Clinton]] as a defendant.<ref>{{cite court
|court= U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Nevada

}}</ref> Her suit alleged that they orchestrated a campaign to discredit her.  Attorney [[Larry Klayman]] of [[Judicial Watch]] represented her.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9807E7D61E31F930A25752C1A9649C8B63| title=West: California: Libel Suit From Clinton Era| work=[[The New York Times]]| date=November 13, 2002| quote=The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, in San Francisco, revived a 1999 libel suit filed by Gennifer Flowers against two former aides to Bill Clinton.| access-date=March 20, 2008 | first=Adam | last=Liptak}}</ref>  In her case, Flowers argued that the defendants ignored obvious warning signs that the television news reports did not conclusively determine that someone had interfered with the tapes.<ref name=uimnhgf /> In 2004, a federal district court dismissed the case with summary judgment.<ref name=uimnhgf>{{cite news| url=http://www.reviewjournal.com/lvrj_home/2004/March-17-Wed-2004/news/23451328.html| title=GENNIFER FLOWERS: Judge rejects lawsuit against Clinton aides| work=[[Las Vegas Review-Journal]]| date=March 17, 2004| quote=Ruling dismisses defamation claim by woman who said she, ex-president had affair| access-date=March 20, 2008}}</ref> The [[U.S. Court of Appeals for the 9th Circuit]] affirmed the lower court's dismissal in 2006.<ref name=sf2006>{{cite news| url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2006/01/09/MNGB7GKNE910.DTL| title=Court tosses Flowers suit against Hillary| work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]]| date=January 9, 2006|access-date=April 3, 2012}}</ref>

title: James Carville
added: Carville had an array of [[Celebrity branding|commercial endorsements]], and starred in print media and television advertisements for leading [[Brand relationship|consumer brands]] including [[Coca Cola]], [[Little Debbie]] snacks, [[Maker’s Mark]] bourbon, [[Heineken]] beer, [[American Express]] credit cards, [[Nike]] shoes, [[Alka-Seltzer]] antacid, the [[National Cotton Council of America|Cotton Council]], [[Ariba]] software.<ref>{{cite news |date= April 18, 2004 |title= From Campaign Trail to Celebrity Circuit|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2004/04/18/us/from-campaign-trail-to-celebrity-circuit.html| work= The New York Times |access-date= March 6, 2020}}</ref>

In 2000, through Bob Chlopak’s Chlopak, Leonard, Schechter & Associates (CLS), a Washington, DC-based public relations firm, Carville enjoyed a sponsorship with [[Playboy]] media, and [[Captain Morgan]] rum that included a trip to [[Hugh Hefner|Hugh Hefner's]] [[Playboy mansion]].<ref>{{cite news |last= Atkinson|first= Claire|date= September 4, 2000 |title= PR Play of the week: Captain Morgan and Carville mix it up |url=  https://www.prweek.com/article/1239795/pr-play-week-capt-morgan-carville-mix |work= PR Week|location= Washington, DC|access-date=February 21, 2021 }}</ref>
